intro: Spergularia capillacea, commonly known as silky sandspurry, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant native to arid and sandy environments. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its prostrate stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Spergularia capillacea is often found in coastal dunes and other disturbed soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand and supporting local ecosystems.
